The worst sequel a game got in gaming history. This is not an "upgraded" game its a downgraded game. You get almost nothing for free, you have to do stupid and long quests in order to unlock characters that were free in ow1. 1 legendary cosmetic costs 20 dollars, and balance update are getting worse with each one. Dont play this game. Play other games like TF2, CS:GO, Paladins, Dead By Daylight PUBG etc, Any other game is better.

I can't even get into the game- after the settings menu it's a black screen- I get the rest of these reviews are troll hate bombing but I seriously can't get the game to work and I don't know what to do-

joining the bandwagon to review bomb this garbage. 

money being the deciding factor in enjoying this game since the "sequel" is terrible. having played the original game since release, it is incredibly discouraging wanting to come back to it and having new characters locked behind a pay wall. 

you don't really feel like you're rewarded for playing this game, unless you want to spend money on it. Battle pass seems tedious to do, and credits are hard to come by. At least when playing OW1, you had a loot box to look forward to after a few games that rewards you either new items or credits to buy new items with.

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.


ä¸æ˜¯äººä»¬æŠ›å¼ƒäº†å®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ã€‚è€Œæ˜¯å®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ä¸ä¼šæ˜¯ç©å®¶çš„è‹±é›„äº†ã€‚å†ä¹Ÿä¸ä¼šæ˜¯äº†ã€‚It's not that people abandoned Overwatch. It's that Overwatch won't be the player's hero anymore. Not Anymore.

Cock-Dick,çœ‹çœ‹ä½ æ•´çš„è¿™ä¸€å¨å±ï¼Œæ˜¯è¦åœ¨ä½ å¦ˆå¦ˆçš„åœ°ä¸‹å®¤é‡ŒæŒ¨å¤šä¹…çš„æ¯’æ‰“æ‰èƒ½å…»æˆä½ è¿™æ ·å¿ƒç†ç•¸å½¢ã€‚æ“æ­»ä½ ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”æ“æ­»ä½ å¦ˆå¦ˆçš„å¤§è‡­é€¼ã€‚

Cockdick, take a look at the tr*sh game you're running. Nobody knows how long do you have to be beaten up in your mother's basement to form your abnormal psychology. F*ck you, and f*ck your mother's big dirty p*ssy.

I have played this game since Season 3 of the Original Overwatch. I was absolutely in love with the game, the changes, the new heroes, the small PvE events we got and I loved that the Lootboxes were optional in terms of whether you'd buy them with real life currency, or play the game, level up, and get lootboxes that way. I loved the entire mechanic of it, free lootboxes, level system, the rank system wasn't absolute gopshite and people genuinely enjoyed the game, even when raging, being toxic and what else you can expect in a competitive game.

What ruined this entire game, was the content drought, the empty promises of a seperate game named "Overwatch 2" that would be PvE only, for us PvE andies to enjoy without ruining the aspect of the actual PvP game we all know and love.
We all believed that they would keep their promise of making this huge, openworld-ish, amazing skill-tree PvE and we were all EXCITED for it. I, like many others, bought the Pre-Release game pass/DLC/whatever you want to call it at this rate, in hopes that my money would go into making that and like many others, I was severely let down when Blizzard announced Overwatch 2.

It was Overwatch, but no level system, no lootboxes, no new conent besides for updated graphics and one less teammate in the game's gamemodes. That was all we were getting at the start. Then, a year of nothing later, get bombed with "We're cancelling it, sorry guys bye" and that was it.
Due to the huge backlash, they've now decided to release these tiny PvE events and new weird hero level systems that are merely a bandaid ontop of a large flesh wound that really isn't doing anything to fix what they did. Also, the Battlepass. I don't even wanna f*cking talk about that.

And that's just ONE of the "Big Game Company" Activision Blizzard's Games, without actually going into the whole mess that is the Company itself. My god.
